rukus.text: (Allah;) The Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman)
It is He Who has taught the Quran
He has Created man
He has taught him to talk (and understand)
The sun and the moon that follow (their) calculated courses
And the herbs (also the term for galaxy of stars) and the trees —Both prostrate (bow) themselves in respect (to Allah)
And the Arch of the Sky — He has raised high (above), and He has set up the balance (of Justice)
So that you may not willfully overstep (the fine) balance
So establish (accurate) weight with justice and do not fall short in the balance
It is He Who has spread out the earth for (His) Creatures
In there is fruit and date-palms, producing the long leaves (enclosing dates)
Also corn, with (its) leaves and stalks for feeding the cattle and the sweet smelling plants
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both (men and jinns') renounce?—
He created man from sounding clay like the clay of pottery
And He created jinns' from a smokeless flame of fire
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
(He is the) Lord of the two easts (east and the far, far east) and the Lord of the two wests (west and the far, far west)
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
(He has created) the two free streams of flowing (salt and sweet) water, meeting together
Between them is a barrier that they do not willfully overstep
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
Out of them come pearls and coral
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
And His are the ships sailing through the seas, high (and majestic) as mountains
Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —
